PROGRAMMING

A clash of creativity in which participant teams compete to create the best piece by completing an unfinished specimen of a classic genre â€“ the famous Role-Playing Games (RPGs) of the Golden Era of computer gaming; adding mechanics relying on their skill at the Python programming language and their understanding of the timeless genre.

GAMING

A battle of the titans in a classic Counter Strike: Global Offensive (CS:GO) 5v5 arena which will be the ultimate test of tactics and reflexes. Spanning over two days of fast- paced action; speed, skill and accuracy will decide who takes the prize with fair play ensured by our gaming teams spectating all matches.

PITCHING

Competitors with inventive minds and a spark for entrepreneurship will fight for the title in front of a team of experienced panelists, presenting their websites and pitching their ideas to prove that they are the finest innovators and second to none.

BETATEST

Problem-solving abilities will be stretched to the edges and as competitors strive to find the correct answer to proceed to the next level. The BetaTest is the ultimate, unparalleled scavenger hunt which offers an unprecedented assortment of grueling questions, which participants engage in a cryptic hunt of epic proportions through the obscure marshes of the vast Internet to complete.

QUIZ

ProjectBeta @ Sanskriti School

A/V EDITING

  • Any video editing software can be used for editing the video
  • Source material will be uploaded on the ProjectBeta Facebook account and the official ProjectBeta website. These will include only video clips, as music and sound effects will be outsourced. All outsourced material must be accredited to the artist
  • Participants will be given two topics to choose from. Clips for both topics will be uploaded. Participants must make a video on one of the two topics.
  • Video can only be 2-2:30 mins long.
  • Participants are to upload the video prior to or on the given date on Youtube.
  • Email to be sent to PB after submission with the name & classes of the participants.
  • Any entries contravening competition rules will be disqualified. The entry may be shown but will not be part of the judging process
  • Participants will be judged on :
    1. Authenticity
    2. Sticking to the central theme
    3. Relevance of the video
    4. Sticking to the time limit
    5. Aesthetic of the video

Change the status quo.
